intro: Goniophlebium synammia, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, velvety hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals and numerous stamens. Goniophlebium synammia is often found in disturbed soils and can become invasive in some areas.
